title: linux magazine brought me here
comment: been looking for a reader for my libreoffice files. all my stuff is stored on my personal owncloud so it's great to have an opendocument published viewer.

title: It will not install on Samsung Galaxy Tap 4
comment: It is a great app for the desktop, but it will not install on my Samsung Galaxy Tap 4 for some reason, hope they will fix the problem soon because it is a great program.

title: Yaayyuhh
comment: Awesome

title: At last
comment: the official libreoffice on Android... thank you.

Needs work, which I know they are doing.  It does not work at all on Android 5.1 when trying to open password protected .odt documents. It crashes immediately. For now, I rate it 2 stars, but I know they are working on it.

title: Excellent
comment: Fully support this open source app,  not like the malware from Microsoft that forces the users to login for viewing the office documents

title: Instant crash
comment: On Nexus 10 opens and instantly crashes.

title: It has problems
comment: Samsung Galaxy Tab (Nook). Reads a while, then crashes. If I open reader, unable to FIND any files. If I go to the file,  it will open as default reader. It just will not keep running.  Frustrating!

title: Lime a Swiss Army knife for documents
comment: Opens pretty much any attachment I receive on my phone and displays it beautifully.

title: Ods files
comment: It does not open ods files,  and crashes.

title: Coming along nicely
comment: It does render nicely although very very slow. This might be because it's such a large app and needs to be slimmed down and bugs fixed. This of course is still in beta.
Best Document Viewer

title: useful
comment: simple yet very useful

title: Libre Office
comment: Excelente :-)
Need the navigator.
Good in A doc
Might be a dream, am I awake?

Just downloaded the LIbreOffice Viewer to use on my Polaroid brand Tablet  earlier this evening(as it's about 7 PM Pacific Daylight Time when I type this) and I have to say so far so good on it.  I used the viewer's editing capabilities(even though they're experimental right now and apparently are not full editing capabilities yet) briefly to edit a document(a story i'm working on actually) and it seemed that the editing function worked pretty good so far.  Definitely looking forward to when full editing is available in the viewer so I can have two ways to work on documents I have saved(I have a Windows 8 laptop with LIbreOffice for the desktop and i've been using LibreOffice for the computer since late 2013 and I have not been disappointed with it). The other of course being the tablet I mentioned.  In any case, I applaud the folks at The Document Foundation for creating a great version of LibreOffice for Android devices and I will definitely be using your product a lot in the future.  Keep up the good work :)

title: Waste of time
comment: Do not download ...not opening any file ...so disappointed

title: Saif
comment: Nice
Great app

As a LO document viewer it's very useful.  It doesn't save any changes I make although it tells me it's saving, but this is a great start being able to view my ODF documents on my tablet.  Thank you devs.

title: OpenSource Matters!
comment: Finally. Was waiting for this. Hopefully all functionalities will be added gradually. 👏👍

title: Muito ruim.
comment: Trava direto ao abrir um arquivo

title: Great Rendering
comment: Tried on my Note 2. Editing spreadsheets not working yet. Rendering is beautiful, if slow. Can't wait for it to go from rendering to full editing. Great job, Libre Office!
thank you

LibreOffice is a powerful open source office suite, with the main established versions being available on the 3 major OSes. The Android version does a great job of inheriting the amount of file types that can be opened and viewed. In addition, the editing of documents is also available and is about as good as the non-mobile versions. With so many file types available to open and document editing being available, the open source LibreOffice for Android is a solid tool for viewing and making some edits on a mobile device.
Not worth it with the lack of functionality.

title: Alright!
comment: Awe some

title: Muy útil
comment: Me abre los documentos perfectamente, solo esperar a que la comunidad le de capacidad de edición y por lo pronto colaboraré de otras formas con el proyecto.

title: Just for releasing it
comment: Finally its released.  I'll update this as I use it.  But something from LibreOffice / Document Foundation has been so needed.

title: External Memory?
comment: Can only browse internal sdcard. No external sdcard support!

title: Seriously 220MB?
comment: After installation it has 220 MB. 82 MB must be on the phone storage. Seriously? How did you program this? Did you use ANY os features or did you program everything from scratch?  No way. This is the best example of how you should NOT write an app. Horrible. Documents Office Viewer has 4.2MB and has all the viewer functions, is much faster and sticks at least a bit to the Android guidelines. Experimental document editing is useless, extremely slow, and not even allowing the keyboard to use word corrections (really).

title: Open source, good rendering
comment: It's somewhat slow, but on a sample docx document it rendered it much better than Google's own Docs app. Not to mention free OpenDocument formats. Thanks, LibreOffice, for extending your open source office suite also to Android.

comment: I <3 LibreOffice
